page.title: 04WELL DRESSING-WIRKSWORTH
page.content: THE MOST FAMOUS DERBYSHIRE TRADITION. PICTURES ARE CREATED ON A WOODEN FRAME COVERED WITH A THIN LAYER OF DAMP CLAY. THE MATERIALS USED FOR THE DESIGN MUST BE NATURAL, AND MAINLY CONSTITUTE FLOWER PETALS, SMALL CONES, SEEDS AND LEAVES. THE WELLS ARE USUALLY GIVEN A BIBLICAL TEXT AS THE IDEA OF CREATING A WELL IS TO THANK GOD FOR LIFE GIVING WATER. VISITORS WHO COME FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD TO SEE THE WELLS ARE ENCOURAGED TO GIVE SOME MONEY WHICH GOES TO A CHARITY. 13 WELLS WERE PRODUCED IN 1985. THE SPRING BANK HOLIDAY WEEKEND IS THE TIME OF YEAR CHOSEN FOR THE WIRKSWORTH WELL-DRESSINGS. A CARNIVAL COINCIDES WITH THE EVENT. THE LOCAL CLERGY TAKE PART IN THE BLESSING OF THE WELLS. THIS TAKES PLACE AT EACH SITE.
